import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import os
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.e31248f5:
features = ['num-of-doors', 'body-style', 'drive-wheels', 'engine-location', 'wheel-base', 'stroke', 'fuel-type', 'horsepower', 'price']
num_features = ['wheel-base', 'stroke', 'horsepower', 'price']
cat_features = ['num-of-doors', 'body-style', 'drive-wheels', 'engine-location', 'fuel-type']

features = pd.DataFrame(df, columns = features)
num_features = pd.DataFrame(df, columns = num_features)
cat_features = pd.DataFrame(df, columns = cat_features)
source.482f99a2:
sns.set_theme(style="white")

g = sns.PairGrid(num_features, diag_sharey=False)
g.map_upper(sns.scatterplot, s=15)
g.map_lower(sns.kdeplot)
g.map_diag(sns.kdeplot, lw=2)
source.65904f76: Price and Horsepower have a strong postive correlation with a value of 0.809575 which was also evident in the previous pairplot.
source.abaa5090: Both two and four doors categories are right skewed and have outliers but IQR of four doors is greater.
source.ad185c63: The above plot contains scatter, density and contour plots of the numerical variables. Stroke is the only feature with normal distribution, and all other features are right skewed. Horsepower and price have a strong correlation.
source.a4dc9cec: From the above plot, it can be said that there are more gas fueled cars as compared to disel fuel cars.
source.a58e9454: Only rwd drive wheels have no outliers, and it's IQR is greater than other two types when comparing with the wheel base.
source.5d207f6d: Sedan body style has the maximum horsepower when including the outlier while hardtop has the maximum horsepower excluding horsepower. And, IQR of hardtop is greater in comparison with other body styles.
